newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London touch lower, trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London touch lower, trade thin.

text.p: Hong Kong shares were mixed to slightly lower early afternoon on profit-taking after another strong session in Hong Kong on Monday, dealers said.
"There has been a bit of profit-taking but most people aren't doing much of anything. It's been pretty dull," one dealer said.
In Hong Kong on Monday, the Hang Seng index closed 97.71 points higher at 13,289.21. The Hang Seng London Reference Index was down 5.90 points at 13,283.31 by 1350 GMT.
